description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eh86g","text":"This protocol details isolation of immune cells from intestinal lamina propria/spleen and flow cytometry.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.section: Isolation of Immune Cells from Intestinal Lamina Propria/Spleen
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aunr4","text":"Dissect the small and large intestines for isolation of intestinal lamina propria cells,  place the small and large intestines immediately    cold PBS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":139,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bi0hn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"AC1CC030D1F911EC811039C72B2CD214","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

steps.section: Isolation of Immune Cells from Intestinal Lamina Propria/Spleen
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ljs8","text":"Open the intestines longitudinally after removing the mesenteric fat and Peyer’s patches (small intestine), wash out the luminal contents with cold PBS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Isolation of Immune Cells from Intestinal Lamina Propria/Spleen
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2h35l","text":"Wash the tissue pieces for     in   dithiothreitol (DTT)/PBS at   on a rocker to remove mucus, followed by a wash for   in   EDTA/  HEPES/PBS at   on a platform shaker ( ) to remove epithelium. steps.section: Isolation of Immune Cells from Intestinal Lamina Propria/Spleen
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"r43q","text":"After a   wash in complete RPMI, digest the tissue in a 6-well plate for   in complete RPMI with   (small intestine) or   (large intestine) collagenase VIII (Sigma) and   DNase (Sigma) in a cell culture incubator (5% CO2).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":219,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":73,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":97,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":120,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":169,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6v678","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"C3D375C0D1F911EC811039C72B2CD214","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":5400,"guid":"C97D80B0D1F911EC811039C72B2CD214","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"150","error_concentration":false,"guid":"F4379CF0D1F911EC811039C72B2CD214","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1810}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"300","error_concentration":false,"guid":"0167C5D0D1FA11EC811039C72B2CD214","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1810}},"4":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"150","error_concentration":false,"guid":"5535A150D1FA11EC811039C72B2CD214","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":205}}}}

steps.section: Isolation of Immune Cells from Intestinal Lamina Propria/Spleen
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ce60","text":"Wash both spleen and intestine immune cells with 0.5% BSA/PBS before staining and fixation (eBioscience Foxp3 / Transcription Factor Staining Buffer Set).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6h9h","text":"Use , CD16/32 antibody (eBioscience) for flow cytometry staining to block the non-specific binding to Fc receptors before surface staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6lot0","text":"Isolate the immune cells from intestinal lamina propria and stain with antibodies against the following markers:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sius","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rbbc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bccd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7c6pe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold _dt-h-left"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold _dt-h-left"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["138","149"],"data":[["Marker","Stain"],["CD103","PerCP-efluor710"],["CD11b","SuperBright645"],["CD11c","FITC"],["CD19","FITC"],["CD3e","PE"],["CD4","APC"],["CD45.2","BV421"],["CD64","APC-Cy7"],["CD8a","APC-e780"],["CSF1R","PE"],["Ly6C","APC"],["MHCII I-A/I-E ","PE or PerCP-efluor710"],["TCRβ ","PerCP-Cy5.5"]],"guid":"B8DB3420D1FC11EC811039C72B2CD214","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Marker","Stain"],["CD103","PerCP-efluor710"],["CD11b","SuperBright645"],["CD11c","FITC"],["CD19","FITC"],["CD3e","PE"],["CD4","APC"],["CD45.2","BV421"],["CD64","APC-Cy7"],["CD8a","APC-e780"],["CSF1R","PE"],["Ly6C","APC"],["MHCII I-A/I-E ","PE or PerCP-efluor710"],["TCRβ ","PerCP-Cy5.5"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}
